gololang.error

Class Result<T,E extends java.lang.Throwable>

  • java.lang.Object
    • gololang.error.Result<T,E>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<T>

    public final class Result<T,E extends java.lang.Throwable>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<T>
    A container object which represent the result of a maybe failing operation.

    This object is used when chaining computations (e.g. using map-filter operations) that can produce an error. Instead of raising an exception, the operation can use this object to encapsulate the result. This is similar to Optional, but also encapsulate the type of error in the form of a Throwable instance that can be raised later.

    This is similar to the Either or Result type in other functional languages (e.g. Haskell, Rust or Scala)

    Typical usage:

    • return empty() instead of returning null,
    • use error(java.lang.Throwable) or fail(java.lang.String) instead of throwing an exception,
    • use ok(java.lang.Object) to return a normal value.

    • Method Detail

      • of

        public static Result<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Throwable> of(java.lang.Object value)
        Dynamic polymorphic constructor.

        Dynamically dispatch on empty(), error(java.lang.Throwable), option(java.util.Optional) or ok(java.lang.Object) depending on the value type. This is mainly useful in Golo code.

        Parameters:
        value - the value to encapsulate
        Returns:
        a Result representing the value

      • empty

        public static <T,E extends java.lang.Throwable> Result<T,E> empty()
        Returns an empty Result.

        Represents a successful computation that returns nothing.

        Returns:
        an empty Result

        public static <T,E extends java.lang.Throwable> Result<T,E> ok(T value)

        Represents a successful computation's result.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the class of the value
        Parameters:
        value - the possibly-null value to describe
        Returns:
        a Result containing the value if the specified value is non-null, otherwise an empty Result

      • fail

        public static <T> Result<T,java.lang.RuntimeException> fail(java.lang.String message)
        Returns a failed Result.

        Represent a computation that failed. This is similar to error(java.lang.Throwable) but only the message is provided, and a RuntimeException is automatically created.

        Parameters:
        message - the message representing the error
        Returns:
        a Result containing a RuntimeException

        public T get()
      throws E extends java.lang.Throwable,
             java.util.NoSuchElementException
        If a value is present, returns the value, if empty throws NoSuchElementException, otherwise throws the contained error.
        Returns:
        the non-null value contained in this Result
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if the Result is empty
        E - if the Result is an error

      • map

        public <U,X extends java.lang.Throwable> Result<U,X> map(java.util.function.Function<? super T,? extends U> mapper)
        If a value is present, apply the provided mapping function to it, otherwise return the Result itself. If the application succeed with a value, return a Result containing it, if the result is null, return an empty Result, otherwise return a Result capturing the Throwable that was thrown.
        Type Parameters:
        U - The type of the result of the mapping function
        Parameters:
        mapper - a mapping function to apply to the value, if present
        Returns:
        a Result describing the result of applying the mapping function to the value of this Result
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the mapping function is null

      • mapError

        public <X extends java.lang.Throwable> Result<T,X> mapError(java.util.function.Function<? super E,? extends X> mapper)
        If this result is an error, apply the provided mapping function to the contained error, otherwise return the Result itself. If the application succeed with a value, return a Result containing it, if the result is null, return an empty Result, otherwise return a Result capturing the Throwable that was thrown.
        Type Parameters:
        X - The type of the result of the mapping function
        Parameters:
        mapper - a mapping function to apply to the error, if present
        Returns:
        a Result describing the result of applying the mapping function to the error of this Result
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the mapping function is null

      • flatMap

        public <U,X extends java.lang.Throwable> Result<U,X> flatMap(java.util.function.Function<? super T,Result<U,X>> mapper)
        If a value is present, apply the provided Result-bearing mapping function to it, otherwise return the Result itself. If the application succeed, return its result, otherwise return a Result capturing the Throwable that was thrown.
        Type Parameters:

      • flatMap

        public Result<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Throwable> flatMap(FunctionReference mapper)
        Golo compatible version of flatMap. See issue 277

      • flattened

        public Result<?,?> flattened()
        Remove one level of result.

        This is actually equivalent to flatMap(identity) (or r.flatMap(f) is equivalent to r.map(f).flattened())

        For instance: 

        
 ok(ok(42)).flattened() == ok(42)
 fail("error").flattened() == fail("error")
 empty().flattened() == empty()
        Returns:
        the value contained in this result if it's a result
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassCastException - when the result does not contain a result.

      • andThen

        public Result<? extends java.lang.Object,? extends java.lang.Throwable> andThen(FunctionReference mapper)
        Same as map or flatMap depending on the type returned by mapper.

        This is a generic version for map and flatMap: if mapper returns a Result, it's equivalent to flatMap, otherwise, it's equivalent to map.

        This allows code such as: 

        
 Ok(21): andThen(|x| -> x + 1): andThen(|x| -> Ok(2 * x)) == Ok(42)

      • either

        public java.lang.Object either(FunctionReference mapping,
                               FunctionReference recover)
                        throws java.lang.Throwable
        Case analysis for the result.

        If the result is a value, apply the first function to it; if it is an error, apply the second function to it.

        Note that if the result is empty, i.e. the value is null, the mapping function is applied to null.

        Parameters:
        mapping - the function to apply to the contained value
        recover - the function to apply to the contained error
        Returns:
        the result of applying the corresponding function
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable

      • either

        public java.lang.Object either(FunctionReference mapping,
                               FunctionReference recover,
                               FunctionReference def)
                        throws java.lang.Throwable
        Three way case analysis for the result.

        If the result is a value, apply the first function to it; if it is an error, apply the second function to it; if it is empty, invoke the third function.

        Parameters:
        mapping - the function to apply to the contained value
        recover - the function to apply to the contained error
        def - the function to invoke if the result is empty (takes no arguments)
        Returns:
        the result of applying the corresponding function
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable

      • map

        public Result<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Throwable> map(FunctionReference mapper)
        Golo compatible version of map. See issue 277

      • filter

        public Result<T,E> filter(java.util.function.Predicate<? super T> predicate)
        If a value is present and matches the given predicate, return a Result describing the value, otherwise return an empty Result. If the Result is empty or is an error, return the Result itself.
        Parameters:
        predicate - a predicate to apply to the value, if present
        Returns:
        a Result describing the value of this Result if it maches the predicate
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the predicate is null

      • reduce

        public java.lang.Object reduce(java.lang.Object init,
                               FunctionReference func)
                        throws java.lang.Throwable
        Reduce this using func with init as initial value.

        For instance: 

        
 Result.ok("b"): reduce("a", |x, y| -> x + y) == "ab"
 Result.empty(): reduce(42, |x, y| -> x + y) == 42
 Result.fail("error"): reduce(42, |x, y| -> x + y) == 42
        Parameters:
        init - the initial value
        func - the aggregation function
        Returns:
        the initial value if this is not a value, the aggregated result otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable

      • apply

        public Result<?,?> apply(Result<?,?> other)
                  throws java.lang.Throwable
        Apply the function contained is this result to the given result.

        If the function has several parameters, a result containing a partialized version is returned, that can be `apply`ed to subsequent results. This makes `Result` an applicative functor.

        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable

      • and

        public Result<?,?> and(Result<?,?> other)
        Conjunctive chaining.
        Parameters:
        other - the other result
        Returns:
        other if this result is a value, otherwise this

        public Result<?,?> or(Result<?,?> other)
        Disjunctive chaining.
        Parameters:
        other - the other result
        Returns:
        other if this result is an error, otherwise this

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
        Indicate whether some other object is equal to this Result. The other object is considered equal if:
        • it is also a Result and;
        • both instances are empty or;
        • both instances have values that are equal via equals() or;
        • both instances are errors of the same type with the same message.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        o - an object to be tested for equality
        Returns:
        true if the other object is equal to this object, otherwise false

        Overrides:

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • destruct

        public Tuple destruct()
        Return a Tuple representing this Result.

        Return a 2-tuple containing the error and the value contained by this Result, so that it can be used in a destructuring golo assignment. The first value is the error, and the second is the correct value (mnemonic: right also means correct). For instance: 

        
 let e, v = Result.ok(42)        # e is null and v is 42
 let e, v = Result.empty()       # e is null and v is null
 let e, v = Result.fail("error") # e is RuntimeException("error") and v is null
        This allows to deal with error in the same way as Go does for instance.
        Returns:
        a 2-tuple containing the error and the value contained by this Result
